pages.text:
.entry-header
Wine Club Tasting
Monday, September 22 at 6:00PM
Illahe Pinot Gris 2024, Willamette Valley, OR
Nose of baked pear, graham cracker crust, fresh lemon zest and chamomile. The palate transitions to flinty minerality and lively aidity.
J. Bookwalter Readers Riesling 2024, Columbia Valley, WA
Rich full mouthfeel loaded with bright Myer lemons, sweet apricots and juicy Comice pears, and a touch of candied orange peel.
R Stuart Love Chardonnay 2023, Willamette Valley, OR
Flavors of lemon curd, pear, white nectarine, lemon bar, starfruit  and key lime.
Illahe Cuvee Miette Pinot Noir 2023, Willamette Valley, OR
Aromas of chocolate, cherry, candied orange and blueberry, clove, toasted walnut and nutmeg.
CLICK TO REGISTER
DOWNLOAD THE APPLICATION
French Wine
Dinner
Sunday, October 12th at 6:00PM
$99 per person, tax and gratuity not included
50% Payment Required
Foie
Foie mousse, pâte à choux, red wine blackberry fennel gastrique, pistachio, poppy seed.
Pairing
: Forget-Brimont Brut Premier Cru Champagne (92 Pts, James Suckling)
En Papillote
Dover sole, acorn squash, mushroom, orange, pink peppercorn cardamom beurre blanc.
Pairing
: Domaine des Chaumes Chablis 2023
Gigot d’Agneau
Whey braised lamb leg, carrots, peas, yukon gold, pomegranate molasses, puff pastry cap.
Pairing:
Domaine de l’Espigouette Gigondas, 2021 (91 Pts, James Suckling)
Meringue
Spiced pear curd, chestnuts, pomegranate arils
Pairing:
Carmes de Rieussec, Sauternes 2018 (91 Pts, James Suckling)
CLICK TO REGISTER
Wine Club Tasting
Monday, August 25 at 6:00PM
Colliano Cuvee Red
40% Cab Franc, 305 Cab Sauv, 30% Merlot
Complex and delicious new world style red wine with a long fruity chocolate finish
Rossello Nebbiolo d’Alba D.O.C.
Fruity cherry nose with crushed strawberries and slightly balsamic. Intense, balanced and harmonious.
Palo Santo Malbec
100% Malbec. Bright violet folor with flowering aromas mixed with red fruits.
Vini Mura “Cortes” Cannonau di Sardegna D.O.C.
Intense ruby red color. The wine has a very fresh fruity nose of strawberries, raspberries and aromatic herbs.
DOWNLOAD THE APPLICATION
Spanish Wine
Dinner
August 11th at 6:00PM
$95 per person, tax and gratuity not included
Pulpo
Salsa verde, spanish olives, fennel, endive, chives, preserved lemon zest, pickled celery, white wine and orange gastrique, olive oil.
Wine Pairing: Bodegas Emilio Moro, Bierzo Godella Polvorete 2023
Clams
Bomba rice cake, sofrito, tomato saffron brodo, fennel fronds, confit tomatoes, cilantro, bell pepper, shrimp toast
Wine Pairing: Gramona Penedes Mart Rose’ 2023
Chorizo
White bean puree, radicchio, gold raisins, smoked oil, Crispy shallots.
Wine Pairing: Bodegas Alto Moncayo, Campo de Borja Garnacha Veraton 2021
Phyllo
Valdeon, braised red wine pears, orange, hazelnuts, apricot, honey.
Wine Pairing: Emilio Hidalgo, Pedro Ximenez Sherry
Tour de France
Wine Club Private Tasting
Monday, July 28th at 6:00pm
Ballarin Brut Cremant de Bordeaux
Made like traditional champagne, but with 50% Cabernet Franc, 30% Sémillon, and 20% Muscadelle.
Domaine Perraud Bourgogne Aligoté 2023
Obscure but traditional white wine from Burgundy.
Domaine Coperet Beaujolais Fleurie Cru ‘CAMPAGNE’ 2023
Cru Beaujolais is a favorite of Master Somms!
Domaine de l’Espigouette 2021 Gigondas, Rhone Valley
It is aged in barrels 12 to 18 months and composed of 70% Grenache and 30% Mourvèdre.
Wine Club Tasting
Monday, June 23 at 6:00PM
Muses Estate, 9 Assyrtiko
Color straw blonde with light shades of green, with gentle aromas of fresh-cut fruit, such as pear and apples.
Excellent structure with a depth of flavors and an acidity which brings the flavors to the fore and adds freshness, with a delightful aftertaste
Cascina D’Or, Dolcetto d’Alba
Intense, pleasant wine. Ruby red with vivid purple hues. Dry, moderately zesty almond, harmonious and balanced.
Uva Non Grata, Gamay
Bouncy, crunchy Gamay, this no-fuss wine is an irresistible fruit bomb packed with amazing primary fruit aromas and delicious soft red berry flavours. Gorgeous Gamay at its best.
Feudi Salentini, Salento Fiano Marpiccolo
Marpiccolo – “Little Sea” On the nose, intense and aromatic bouquet with notes of ripe pears and elderflowers.
On the palate, almonds and citrus notes enhanced by a fresh and delicate taste.
Italian Wine Dinner
Monday, June 9
6:00PM
$95 per person
(tax & 20% gratuity not included)
Make your reservation today by emailing
TheCrazyCorkWineBar@gmail.com
Please let us know the number of guests, and of any food allergies or sensitivities.
A deposit of $95 per couple is required.
Course 1
Scallop crudo
Aji amarillo and orange cumin coulis, pickled blueberries, blood orange, basil.
Pairing: Terre di Rai Prosecco DOC Extra Dry
Course 2
Ricotta Gnudi
Roasted garlic and lemon cream, beech mushrooms, sugar snap peas, parmesan crisp, sweet pea tendrils.
Pairing: Agriverde Natum Pinot Grigio IGT 2024
Course 3
Porchetta
Braised pork belly, crispy pork skin, bell pepper rub, roasted fennel, celery root soubise, duck fat raisins.
Pairing: Cascina d’Or Barolo DOCG 2019
Course 4
Hand rolled truffle
Pistachio, dates, and dark chocolate.
Pairing: Martha’s Tawny Port
Blind
Cabernet Wine Dinner
Monday, April 14
Two Seatings: 5:00PM & 7:30PM
$85 per person, tax and tip not included
4 carefully selected cabernet sauvignons in numbered glasses for you to enjoy!
But what are they?
Seating is limited.
Make your reservation today by emailing
TheCrazyCorkWineBar@gmail.com
Please include your preferred time and the number of guests.
Please let us know of any food allergies or sensitivities.
Course 1
24 hour duck confit ravioli, braised lacinato kale, creamy duck demi glace.
Course 2
Braised beef cheeks, melted leek and crimini risotto, roasted radish, beef jus.
Course 3
Spiced Chocolate panna cotta, macerated berries, chantilly cream.
_______________________________________
Wine Club Tasting
Monday, March 31 @5:30PM
Les Vignobles Gueissard Cotes de Provence Rose 2023
Bon Ton Napa Valley Rose 2023 (barrel fermented & aged!)
CALA Terre Siciliane Dario Serrentino Rosso 2022
Stolpman Vineyards Syrah Santa Barbara 2023
____________________________
Wine Tasting with Foxen Vineyards & Winery
March 11, 2025 @
6:30PM
Make your reservations today by email! Space is limited to 16 guests. $35 per person.
Chenin Blanc Old Vines Ernesto Wickenden Vineyard Santa Maria Valley (2023)
Vinous: 93 points
Chardonnay Block UU Bien Nacido Vineyard Santa Maria Valley (2020)
Vinous: 94 points
Santa Maria Valley Pinot Noir (2021)
Wine Spectator: 91 points
Syrah Williamson-Dore Vineyard Santa Ynez Valley (2020)
International Wine Report: 93 points
Jenny Williamson Dore
Jenny has been involved in the Santa Barbara County wine industry for over thirty years: primarily in communications, marketing, and sales. In 2001, she left her position as the Director of Sales and Marketing for Cambria Winery to be alongside her husband Dick at Foxen. Jenny and Dick are settled in the Santa Ynez Valley where they enjoy life as growers of their eight-acre Williamson-Doré Vineyard, and travel—for both Foxen business and pleasure. When she’s not out selling wine, Jenny can be found tending her garden or playing with their many grandkids.
Valentine’s Day Dinner Menu
February 14, 2025
Make your reservations today! Space is limited. Three course special menu for $49.95 a person must be ordered in advance or order from regular menu.
STARTERS
Bruschetta
Italian bruschetta made in-house, served with toasted crostini and balsamic glaze
OR
Togarashi AAA Tuna
Seared and served with horseradish caper aioli, sashimi sauce, and chilled seaweed salad
MAIN PLATES
Prime Short Rib
12-hour braised prime short rib, Parmesan polenta, and lemon thyme roasted carrots
OR
Salmon Brûlée
Brûléed fresh salmon, pancetta sweet potato hash, roasted onion, and chili oil
SWEETS
Salted caramel chocolate ganache cheesecake
OR
Italian almond cheesecake with raspberry glaze
$49.95 per person | Tax and gratuity not included
Please call 407-473-9902 for reservations
.entry-content .clear
